div.pre: 2133 Leonforte, near Nissoria, 15 km. NE of Enna, 1952 Burial: c. 340-330 B.C. (Jenkins) Contents: 327 AR. Pot hoard Acragas: 1 tetradr. Gela: 1 tetradr. Messana: tetradr. Syracuse: 4 decadr. (1 Cimon, 3 Euaine- tos) 19 tetradr. Rash Melcarth: 2 tetradr. Siculo-Punic: 1 tetradr. (Arethusa/horse and palm-tree) Athens: 1 tetradr. (4th cent.) Pegasi Corinth: 159 (to Per. V with Ν-all sym- bols) Ambracia: 16 Anactorium: 10 Apollonia: 1 Argos: 3 Dyrrhachium: 15 Leucas: 78 (over half with caduceus) Syracuse: 15 Disposition: Syracuse † Gentili, NSc 1954, pp. 58-70, illus. Jenkins, ANSCent., p. 374; Gela, p. 155 Currò Pisanò, AIIN 1962-4, pp. 230, 239 (s.v. Nissoria) Gentili records 2 pegasi of Thyrrheium; these are, however, issues of Leucas with Θ on obv. The numbers for Am- bracia raise a difficulty. Gentili did not use Ravel and does not clearly identify the issues; 16 seems to be the maxi- mum identifiable in his list. In 1969, however, K noted the following va- rieties in this hd,: Ravel 14, 42, A24/ P20, 63, 79/80, 91, 109, 137, 138, 141, 146, 147, 166, 169, 171, 172, 174/5, A77/cf. P118, 180, 187 (3), 195, and 2 unc.
